quizSrc.term: The Transfers of Undertakings, Collective Redundancies, and Employer Insolvency Directives are often referred to as...A. Restructuring directivesB. Restructuring regulationsC. Restructuring rulesD. Restructuring notes
quizSrc.definition: A. Restructuring directives

quizSrc.term: The Council is also commonly called A. the Council of the European UnionB. the Council of MinistersC. A and B are correctD. A and B are incorrect
quizSrc.definition: C. A and B are correct

quizSrc.term: All states have a private and a public sector, the public sector is financedby...A. TaxB. DonationC. GovernmentD. Individuals
quizSrc.definition: A. Tax

quizSrc.term: What is a document that allows the owners to demonstrate their ownership on the goods?A. Sea waybillB. Transport documentC. Consignment noteD. Bill of lading
quizSrc.definition: D. Bill of lading

quizSrc.term: Is European Union citizenship status established by Article 20 TFEU?A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: What TEU is abbreviated for?A. Treaty of the Europe UnificationB. Treaty of the European UnitC. Treaty of the European Utility D. Treaty on the European Union
quizSrc.definition: D. Treaty on the European Union

quizSrc.term: Which version of TFEU - Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union - is currently agreed by member states?A. Maastricht versionB. Amsterdam versionC. Lisbon versionD. Nice version
quizSrc.definition: C. Lisbon version

quizSrc.term: Companies and contracts related by both contracts and companies are institutions in the service of private autonomy.A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: "Territorial allocation for its distributors in licensing relations is an IPR-related exercise requiring vigilance by a dominant company". How do you think about this statement?A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: In most countries in Europe, motorcyclists are allowed to travel on motorways, but people on mopeds are not. This is a clear difference in treatment. What is the correct statement for this situation?A. There is no discrimination. Because there are substantial objective differences between motorcycles and mopeds in terms of speed.B. It is discrimination.C. There is no discrimination because the treatment is decided by every country in the EU.D. There is no correct answer
quizSrc.definition: A. There is no discrimination. Because there are substantial objective differences between motorcycles and mopeds in terms of speed.

quizSrc.term: Why unifying international law is deemed particularly important?A. Because the law of the same country is applied regardless of in which member state the dispute is adjudicated.B. Because the judgments given by a court of a member state are recognized and enforced in the other member states.C. A and B are correct.D. A and B are incorrect.
quizSrc.definition: C. A and B are correct.

quizSrc.term: From which viewpoint that taxes can be classified?A. GDPB. IncomeC. Economic, legal or tax policyD. All are not correct
quizSrc.definition: C. Economic, legal or tax policy

quizSrc.term: What does the Information and Consultation Directive purpose to do?A. This directive is to establish a general framework which sets out minimum requirements for the right to information and consultation of employees.B. This directive is to establish a detailed framework which sets out celling requirements for the right to information and consultation of employees.C. This directive is to establish the right to information and consultation of employers.D. None of the answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: A. This directive is to establish a general framework which sets out minimum requirements for the right to information and consultation of employees.

quizSrc.term: The so-called Rome Treaty is the name of the original treaty which later set the background for:A. TEUB. TFEUC. TEU and TFEUD. It is another treaty
quizSrc.definition: C. TEU and TFEU

quizSrc.term: A copyright protects the rights of__A. creators of derivative works for an indefinite period of time.B. creators of original works for an indefinite period of time. C. creators of derivative works for a defined period of time. D. creators of original works for a defined period of time.
quizSrc.definition: D. creators of original works for a defined period of time.

quizSrc.term: What is not a condition set out in the Regulation that need to be fulfilled to intervene in a merger?A. An anticompetitive agreement between two companies.B. EU dimension.C. Significantly impediment of effective competition in particular through creating or strengthening of a dominant position.D. Concentration.
quizSrc.definition: A. An anticompetitive agreement between two companies.

quizSrc.term: Is legal certainty called a fundamental principle of union law?A. TrueB. FalseC. There has no principle named legal certainty in the union lawD. None of the answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: The council is made up ofA. All are correctB. MinistersC. EU's statesD. Heads of States or Governments.
quizSrc.definition: B. Ministers

quizSrc.term: Is EU labour law mostly regulated in and mostly made up of regulations?A. YesB. No
quizSrc.definition: B. No

quizSrc.term: The principle of proportionality has been adopted from... and it is applied in all fields of EU law.A. French lawB. Scotland lawC. UK lawD. German law
quizSrc.definition: D. German law

quizSrc.term: What has been described as being the DNA of EU law and the cornerstone on which European integration is built?A. All are correctB. principle of proportionalityC. The principle of transparencyD. The principle of non-discrimination
quizSrc.definition: D. The principle of non-discrimination

quizSrc.term: Who is company's stakeholders?A. All are correctB. CreditorC. EmployeesD. Shareholders
quizSrc.definition: A. All are correct

quizSrc.term: The legal certainty principle can be used in...A. Two different ways, both as a tool for interpretation and as a standard of judicial review.B. One way, which is to secure the transparency of the lawC. Three ways, which is a tool for interpretation, a standard of judicial review and a tool for resolving disputesD. None of the answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: A. Two different ways, both as a tool for interpretation and as a standard of judicial review.

quizSrc.term: Most EU publications are available online?A. TrueB. Flase
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: Are taxes the result of a voluntary decision by individualsA. No. They're imposed on taxpayers by national political decisions of parliament and other political subdivisionsB. Yes. Taxes are voluntary agreements between individuals.C. Yes. Because the nature of taxes is depending on the honesty of individuals.D. None of the provided answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: A. No. They're imposed on taxpayers by national political decisions of parliament and other political subdivisions

quizSrc.term: Is treating importers of liquors less favourably than those of table wine discriminatory? A. YesB. No. Table wine is more profitable, so its producers are required to be treated with more favours.C. No. Because liquors are more harmful than table wine so we should treat them less favourably to discourage the use of these.D. There is no correct answer
quizSrc.definition: A. Yes

quizSrc.term: Flexicurity is aboutA. Combining flexibility for employersB. Security for employeesC. A and B are correctD. A and B are incorrect
quizSrc.definition: C. A and B are correct

quizSrc.term: The free movement of services is one of the fundamental treaty freedoms regulated in Article 56 of the Treaty of the Functioning of the European UnionA. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: The benefits of competition that consumers may receive is... A. Offering more products with cheaper priceB. In crease a monopoly and outcomes of the companiesC. The products in the market will be variously enrichedD. More promotions between competitors will benefit consumers
quizSrc.definition: A. Offering more products with cheaper price C. The products in the market will be variously enriched D. More promotions between competitors will benefit consumers

quizSrc.term: Is it correct that the charter of fundamental rights was proclaimed in Nice on the 7th of December 2000 and became legally binding in the same year?A. Yes, it is correctB. No. The charter of fundamental rights was proclaimed in Nice on the 7th of December 2000. However, it became legally binding only in December 2009, when the Lisbon treaty entered into force.C. No. The charter of fundamental rights was proclaimed in Nice and become legally binding on the 7th of December 2000.D. None of the provided answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: B. No. The charter of fundamental rights was proclaimed in Nice on the 7th of December 2000. However, it became legally binding only in December 2009, when the Lisbon treaty entered into force.

quizSrc.term: The aim of the (96/71/EC) Posted Workers Directive is to enable the free movement of persons and services and to provide protection for workers in the case of the posting of workers and the transnational provision of services.A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: Resale price maintenance (RPM - establishing licensee's sales price) in licensing relations is an IPR-related exercise requiring vigilance by a dominant company. What is your identification about this?A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: Is it true that the current version of the TEU and TFEU contain very much of the old original treaty? A. True. The current version of the TEU and TFEU still contain very much of the old original treatyB. False. Both TEU and TFEU are significantly different from the original versionsC. False. Only TFEU is different from the original versionsD. False. Only TFEU is significantly different from the original versions
quizSrc.definition: A. True. The current version of the TEU and TFEU still contain very much of the old original treaty

quizSrc.term: The Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP) is an integral part of the Common Security and Defense Policy (CSDP)?A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: A. True

quizSrc.term: The flexibilisation of the labour market has led to an increase in...A. fixed-term workB. Temporary agency workC. Self-employmentD. All are correct
quizSrc.definition: D. All are correct

quizSrc.term: EU's Regulations must be transposed by the national legislator into the national legal order.A. TrueB. False
quizSrc.definition: B. False

quizSrc.term: Is treating traders in lamb meat less favourably than traders discriminatory?A. YesB. NoC. It requires more information to decide on the case but generally, there is no discriminationD. There is no correct answer
quizSrc.definition: C. It requires more information to decide on the case but generally, there is no discrimination

quizSrc.term: "Patent protection is more important in industries with long lifecycles, like pharmaceutical industry, than the opposite like, for example the mobile telephone industry."A. This statement is correctB. This statement is incorrect
quizSrc.definition: A. This statement is correct

quizSrc.term: Refusal to license an essential facility is an IPR-related exercise requiring vigilance by a dominant company. Is it correct?A. YesB. No
quizSrc.definition: A. Yes

quizSrc.term: Which transport service falls under the general Treaty provisions on the free movement of service?A. TrainB. Air transportC. Road transportD. Inland waterways
quizSrc.definition: A. Train C. Road transport D. Inland waterways

quizSrc.term: The significance of the principle of non-discrimination can be seen in: A. It permeates every aspect of EU lawB. It binds both the EU and all its institutionsC. It binds the member states and it can even bind private parties within the member statesD. All are correct
quizSrc.definition: D. All are correct

quizSrc.term: If the national system might not be in line with the provisions of EU law.A. Yes. Since EU rights and obligations very often are dependent on a national system.B. No. Since the principle of legal certainty require that the national system must be in line with the provisions of EU law.C. Yes. This is the principle of EU law.D. No answer is correct
quizSrc.definition: A. Yes. Since EU rights and obligations very often are dependent on a national system.

quizSrc.term: What are the criteria governing the refusal of registration for lack of distinctiveness?A. Generic TermsB. Descriptive SignsC. All of others are correctD. Letters, Numerals and Basic Geometrical Shapes
quizSrc.definition: C. All of others are correct

quizSrc.term: Who will elect the European Parliament?A. Member countries of the EUB. The head of statesC. the citizens of the EUD. The UN
quizSrc.definition: C. the citizens of the EU

quizSrc.term: The institutions of the EU identified in Article 13 TEU include the European Parliament, the European Council, the European Commission, the Council, the Court of Justice of the European Union and...A. the European Central BankB. the Court of AuditorsC. the European Central Bank and the Court of AuditorsD. none of the answers is correct
quizSrc.definition: C. the European Central Bank and the Court of Auditors

quizSrc.term: Which of the following statements accurately depicts copyright law?A. A copyright protects an invention that is original.B. It protects not an expression, but actual ideas and facts.C. It protects the functional and utilitarian aspects of a product.D. It protects inventors rather than authors.E. It protects original, creative expression.
quizSrc.definition: E. It protects original, creative expression.

quizSrc.term: What was one of the main features of the Treaty of Maastricht?A. The Court of Justice of the EU was established.B. The European Union was established. C. It established a European Constitution.D. The Charter of Fundamental Rights was adopted.
quizSrc.definition: B. The European Union was established.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is the correct definition as provided by the EU Commission for the combination of the relevant market?A. A relevant geographic market comprises the area in which the firms concerned are involved in the supply of products or services and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous.B. A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as similar or substitutable by the consumer by reason of the products' target group, fabric and intended use.C. A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as provided in an area in which the firms concerned or retailer are located and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous.D. None of the provided answers is correct.
quizSrc.definition: A. A relevant geographic market comprises the area in which the firms concerned are involved in the supply of products or services and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous.

quizSrc.term: What are some of the functions and roles of the European Commission?(Check all that apply) | It oversees the practice of the other institutions of the EU, such as the Council. | It acts as the "Guardian of the Treaties". | It sets out general guidelines for EU policies. | It proposes new Legislation.
quizSrc.definition: It acts as the "Guardian of the Treaties". | It proposes new Legislation.

quizSrc.term: Following concerns from animal rights campaigners in several member states about the cruelty of seal hunting, and following the introduction by a number of member states of rules prohibiting or limiting the marketing of seal meat and other seal products, the EU introduced a Regulation banning the import of seal meat and other products made from seals. The legal basis for the Regulation was Article 114 TFEU. Several organizations representing seal hunters and traders in seal products brought an action before the Court of Justice of the EU challenging this Regulation, on the grounds that the it breached the principle of conferral, as the EU did not have competence to ban the import of seal products. You are a lawyer advising the EU institutions. What is your advice? | Argue that the measure is necessary for the proper regulation of the internal market. | Argue that the measure is necessary for the functioning of the internal market. | Admit that the EU is wrong and that the Regulation should be invalidated. | Argue that animal welfare is a legitimate interest of both the member states and of the EU, and therefore the EU has competence to legislate where this is necessary to achieve a high standard of animal welfare.
quizSrc.definition: Argue that the measure is necessary for the functioning of the internal market.

quizSrc.term: According to an EU directive, the Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that every worker is entitled to paid annual leave of at least four weeks.Emma Larsson works for a private employer who refuses to grant her the said four weeks of annual leave, since she has been on sick leave during the better part of the past year.According to the national applicable law, a company only has to grant paid annual leave to employees who have actually been working during at least half of the reference period (constituting the past year). However, said national law also stipulates that certain absences, such as those due to maternity leave or work-related accidents, shall count as periods of actual work for the purposes of calculating the length of paid leave that an employee is entitled to. Emma's employer claims that her sick leave cannot count as a period of actual work and that she has, hence, not actually worked for the minimum period of time required for her to be granted paid annual leave.Can Emma force her employer to grant her the four weeks of paid annual leave that is stipulated in the EU directive? | Yes, since the national law should be given an EU conform interpretation, her sick leave should be counted as periods of actual work. | No, but she could possibly sue the Member State where she is working for damages, since the Member State has not implemented the Directive correctly.
quizSrc.definition: Yes, since the national law should be given an EU conform interpretation, her sick leave should be counted as periods of actual work.

quizSrc.term: Even if a trademark right exists a third party shall, under certain circumstances, be allowed to use the trademark. Which of the following is allowed regarding usage of a trademark, in the course of trade? (Check all that apply) | More or less all types of trademark use is allowed, as long as it is in accordance with honest practices in industrial or commercial matters. | It is allowed to use a competitor's trademark where it is necessary to indicate the intended purpose of a product or service. | It is allowed to use one's own name in commercial information | It is allowed to use a competitors name and address in commercial information. | It is allowed to use a competitor's trademark in order to benefit from the goodwill of the competitors trademarks. | It is allowed to use a competitor's trademark in keyword advertising in order to inform potential costumers about an offer to sell products that are confusingly similar to the products provided by the competitor.
quizSrc.definition: It is allowed to use a competitor's trademark where it is necessary to indicate the intended purpose of a product or service. | It is allowed to use one's own name in commercial information.

quizSrc.term: A trademark infringement may be defined as an unauthorised use of a trademark. However, in order for such use to be regarded as infringing a trademark right there are a number of prerequisites that have to be fulfilled. Which of the following is a prerequisite for an infringement according to article 5 trademark directive? (Check all that apply) | The use in question is not descriptive. | The use regards use of any sign which is identical with a protected trademark in relation to goods or services which are identical with those for which the trade mark is registered. | The use in question has to be performed within 5 years from the day of registration. | The use gives result to a likelihood of confusion.
quizSrc.definition: The use regards use of any sign which is identical with a protected trademark in relation to goods or services which are identical with those for which the trade mark is registered. | The use gives result to a likelihood of confusion.

quizSrc.term: The relevant market combines the product market and the geographic market, which of the following is the correct definition as provided by the EU Commission? | A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as interchangeable or substitutable by the consumer by reason of the products' characteristics, prices and intended use. | A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as similar or substitutable by the consumer by reason of the products' target group, fabric and intended use. | A relevant geographic market comprises the area in which the firms concerned are involved in the supply of products or services and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous. | A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as provided in an area in which the firms concerned or retailer are located and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous.
quizSrc.definition: A relevant product market comprises all those products and/or services which are regarded as interchangeable or substitutable by the consumer by reason of the products' characteristics, prices and intended use. | A relevant geographic market comprises the area in which the firms concerned are involved in the supply of products or services and in which the conditions of competition are sufficiently homogeneous.
